Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery plate; white slip; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of lions to right (of first only paw remaining, of second hind leg, rump with added red and underbelly with red); incised rosettes and dot as filling ornament; exterior reserved save two bands.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd appears twice in the catalogue of Lemos 1991 as no. 1410, and no. 1448.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 318, no. 1410, p. 322, no. 1448)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2148) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
